column1: Turinsk (Russian: Туринск) is a town and the administrative center of Turinsky District of Sverdlovsk Oblast
column3: located on the right bank of the Tura River midway between Verkhoturye and Tyumen
column4: near its confluence with the Yarlynka
column5: 253 kilometers (157 mi) northeast of Yekaterinburg. Population: 17

column1: It was founded in 1600 as an ostrog in place of the ancient town of Yepanchin
column2: which was razed by Yermak Timofeyevich in 1581.
